name: Hotel Alimandi Tunisi

reviews.text: This is a very good but small hotel. The rooms are modern and very well appointed with every luxury imaginable, including marble everything, flat screen tv, 2 double beds, very good air conditioning. The only thing I could complain about was they seem to be a bit short staffed (although my stay was during an Italian holiday so that may explain the shortage). The breakfast buffet was just ok in my opinion. I really appreciated the free airport shuttle. This is a very generous thing to offer to guests, easily saving us about 80 euro. As noted, the location is perfect. The staff was very helpful. I would especially like to thank Aldo for his kindness.
reviews.title: Very modern
Highly-recommended modern, friendly hotel
reviews.text: Our stay at Hotel Alimandi could not have been better. The staff was friendly and helpful, and our room was large, modern, clean, and quiet. The location was excellent - across the street from the entrance to the Vatican Museum and a few blocks away from 2 different Metro stops. The breakfast buffet was delicious. We were also very grateful for the free shuttle service to the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Rome.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: Spotless, beautifully furnished rooms, friendly (day and night), very reasonable prices, fantastically situated (50 yards from vatican museum entrance), easily accessable by bus and metro, 5minute walk from st peters square. Absolutely Perfect.

reviews.title: Wonderful in the summer
reviews.text: We had a fantastic time. The AC works wonderfully (unlike many more expensive Rose hotels), keeping our room cool in a hot July.

reviews.title: Excellent Place to Stay
reviews.text: The staff was wonderful and the location was ideal (we could watch the Vatical Museum line forming while enjoying our complimary breakfast). And all for a very reasonable price. We look forward to heading back.

This was our second stay at the Hotel Alimandi. Rome was the first stop on our 2005 trip to Europe between September and October. Other stays included the Residence La Tavolozza in Positano, the Hotel Bernardi-Semenzato in Venice, and the Mercure Tour Eiffel Suffern in Paris. Also see my reviews of these hotels.
reviews.title: A second superb experience

reviews.text: This year we stayed at the Alimandi for six nights. Last year, it was 4 nights. Truth be told, as far as I'm concerned, there is no reason to stay at any other hotel in Rome. It will always be our home away from home in Rome. The Alimandi is a family-run hotel with the emphasis on family. The Alimandis are a welcoming, friendly, and happy group of people. The Alimandis have two hotel buildings and our stay was at the original building at #8 via Tunisi. The other Alimandi is at #1, at the top of steps that lead to the Vatican Wall. The Alimandi brothers constantly walk back and forth between their two hotels.
reviews.title: An excellent hotel and well worth your consideration.
Peaceful and personal; convenient and comfortable
reviews.text: Our room was spotless. The sheets fresh and clean, the bathrooms scrubbed, and new towels were placed every day. The front desk staff is helpful and they speak very good English. At any time of the day, there is at least one of the owners present, be it Luigi, Paolo, or Enrico. They are the Alimandi brothers and they all live within seconds of the hotel - as in across the street in apartment buildings. The front desk is staffed with Alimandi relatives - be they nieces or nephews. An added bonus of staying here is the complimentary airport shuttle provided by the hotel. Rides are available until the early afternoon and the driver is - an Alimandi.

reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
reviews.text: The breakfast is included in the price of the room. It's served each morning from 7 until 10 in the rooftop garden (both open-air and covered seating). The breakfast is outstanding. Chef Francesco (yes, an Alimandi) serves up a variety of foods including chicken and potatoes, zucchini and mushrooms, and many other hearty dishes. He's constantly making fresh scrambled eggs. There are cereals, pastries, and sliced meats (salami, mortadella, and prosciutto, etc.). There is juice or milk or tea. There is world class coffee - even American-style. There is fruit (prunes, pears, peaches, pineapple). On a diet? There is yogurt. You can make your own toast. There are even power bars and other treats. And of course, there are wonderful pies baked by Chef Francesco himself. He is a hard-working man. Not only does he prepare the food - the rooftop garden seats around 75 or so people - but Francesco greets you and wants to make sure you enjoy your food. Another bonus, a great view of the Vatican and the tip of St. Peter's dome. After hours, you can visit the rooftop for quiet moments - perhaps some late-evening wine or a cigarette for those who smoke. No smoking inside the hotel itself, of course.

reviews.title: Great Breakfast!
reviews.text: I should also mention that the Alimandi has a workout room (including a stairmaster), an internet connection station off the workout room, a billiard room, a room with a bar and piano, and a television lounge. All are for the guests. There are also TVs in each room, although why anybody would want to watch television when all of Rome awaits is beyond me.

reviews.title: Great Customer Service
reviews.text: We enjoyed our one night stay at Alimandi the night before we left Italy. We selected that hotel for the free shuttle service to the airport, that saved us approximately 50 Euros.
All the staff was extremely helpful. The front desk staff provided us with coffee in the morning before the airport shuttle even though breakfast was not yet served.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Alimandi 3-star from May 11-May 15. The staff was helpful and friendly. They were willing to help with dining suggestions. They helped us with bus routes and and called the taxi for us.
reviews.title: alimandi is a great value

reviews.text: The room is a little small but was absolutely immaculate. The shower was large and had a litte stool if you wanted to sit. There was a voltage switch so you could use 120V or 230V.
reviews.title: Nice & Friendly Hotel
I highly reccomend the Hotel Alimandi
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast was yummy. It was served in a rooftop room that had a wonderful view of St. Peter's cathedral.

Very convenient to the Vatican - literally, 100 feet from the entrance to the Vatican Museums. The breakfast is very nice, the breakfast staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are clean and modern, and the location is convenient to all of Rome. The front desk staff is slightly clueless, but all in all I would recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was perfect, just a block from the Vatican. I'd recommend it to anyone travelling to Rome. Our room was really nice, clean, big enough for the 2 of us and well supplied with accessories. There is a lovely roof top restaurant that served a really nice breakfast (by a bubbly chef!). The people running the hotel were extremely helpful, starting from when we arrived as our safe didn't work, and they replaced it immediately.
reviews.title: Great place
Total Fiasco
reviews.text: When we go back to Rome in the future we'll go back to this hotel.

reviews.title: What a great place
reviews.text: TM&KR

Booked 6 months in advance as I have stayed here before. When my family and I arrived I was told the hotel was full. A tour bus had come in with extra people so they gave away my room. He told me he had a solution and took me across the street to an apartment and told me we could stay there. Great except that his brother emerged in a bath robe and we were told he would be there during our visit. We walked the neighborhood and wound up at the Spring House. Never again! Only in Italy.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

description: The Hotel Alimandi, a three star property, is situated near the Vatican Museum (Sistine Chapel). It is managed by various members of the family who are able to speak either English, French or German. Completely restructured, all rooms have a private bathroom, a direct-dial telephone, air conditioning, colour television and radio, hair drier and safe-deposit box. A large terrace is always at the disposal of our guests. Parking available.
